task.title: Transcribe Data
task.shortdesc: Transcribe data from the media file.

taskbody.context: With the Media Player open, from the Record Data view:

step.cmd: Click on the play button to the left of the Segment tier (CMD/CTRL+R) and type or use the IPA Map to enter the utterance into the Orthography tier.
Click on the Orthography tier and add word groups for each word by clicking New group after current.
step.stepresult: This will generate corresponding word groups in the IPA Target and IPA Actual tiers as well as any other group-aligned tiers.

step.cmd: If you wish to use built-in dictionaries of pronounced forms, select the View IPA Lookup menu item. Otherwise, type or use the IPA Map to enter the IPA Target and IPA Actual transcriptions into the fields with the same name.
step.stepresult: If you use IPA Lookup, a new view will appear with two tabs: Record Lookup and Console. Record Lookup is focused by default.To change dictionary language, click on the IPA Dictionary menu in the IPA Lookup view and select desired dictionary (listed by ISO-639-3 Language Code, see for instructions for viewing the codes list). Language preferences may also be changed in the Preferences dialog.

step.cmd: In Record Lookup, choose whether to Overwrite existing transcriptions, and select whether to transcribe IPA Target or IPA Actual by clicking on the check boxes.
Click Set to the right of the utterance in Record Lookup to transcribe the record as shown, or click the Set button next to an individual group to transcribe only that group.
step.stepresult: The selected transcription will appear in the IPA Target and/or IPA Actual tiers.If there is more than one transcription available in the selected dictionary for a word, there will be multiple entried listed in the Record Lookup. Select the desired transcription by clicking on it before you Set the group or utterance.

step.cmd: You may further modify any transcriptions in the IPA Target and IPA Actual fields by typing or using the IPA Map.
